name: Spawning Substrate Quality
functionStatement: Physical and chemical conditions enable spawning, juvenile growth, migration, and stress survival of target taxa.
descriptionMarkdown: Clean gravel/vegetation is present if historically expected, unless alternative spawning is normal.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Assess percent of clean gravel or other suitable spawning substrate for target species and note fine sediment cover.

inputs.label: Spawning Substrate Quality
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon;

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Clean or appropriate substrate with minimal silt. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Some silt but still feasible for spawning. (Suggested index range 0.50-0.69)

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Heavily silted with limited spawning success expected. (Suggested index range 0.30-0.49)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: No suitable substrate. High embeddedness, bedrock, or other limiting condition. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.29)

references: EPA Water Quality Portal (turbidity/TSS where available)

sourceMetadata.metricDataSource: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon;

bin1.name: Poor
bin1.desc: No suitable substrate. High embeddedness, bedrock, or other limiting condition.

bin2.name: Fair
bin2.desc: Some silt but still feasible for spawning. / Heavily silted with limited spawning success expected.

bin3.name: Good
bin3.desc: Clean or appropriate substrate with minimal silt.
